channel.title: CVE Feed for WPStaging -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for WPStaging -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-5551|2024-08-01T21:18:06.505Z -- wpstaging -- wp%20staging%20pro%20wordpress%20backup%20plugin
item.description: The WP STAGING Pro WordPress Backup Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 5.6.0. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'sub' parameter called from the WP STAGING WordPress Backup Plugin - Backup Duplicator & Migration plugin. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to include any local files that end in '-settings.php' via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-5551|2024-06-15T20:44:47.587Z -- wpstaging -- wp%20staging%20pro%20wordpress%20backup%20plugin
item.description: The WP STAGING Pro WordPress Backup Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 5.6.0. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'sub' parameter called from the WP STAGING WordPress Backup Plugin - Backup Duplicator & Migration plugin. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to include any local files that end in '-settings.php' via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-3682|2024-06-04T17:31:03.712Z -- wpstaging -- wp%20staging%20pro%20wordpress%20backup%20plugin
item.description: The WP STAGING and WP STAGING Pro plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in versions up to, and including, 3.4.3, and versions up to, and including, 5.4.3, respectively, via the ajaxSendReport function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data from a log file, including system information and (in the Pro version) license keys. Successful exploitation requires an administrator to have used the 'Contact Us' functionality along with the "Enable this option to automatically submit the log files." option.

item.title: CVE-2024-3682|2024-08-01T20:20:00.842Z -- wpstaging -- wp%20staging%20pro%20wordpress%20backup%20plugin
item.description: The WP STAGING and WP STAGING Pro plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in versions up to, and including, 3.4.3, and versions up to, and including, 5.4.3, respectively, via the ajaxSendReport function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data from a log file, including system information and (in the Pro version) license keys. Successful exploitation requires an administrator to have used the 'Contact Us' functionality along with the "Enable this option to automatically submit the log files." option.
